questions.question: Why does the charge move from n-type region to p-type region in a diode, even when there's is no applied electric field

explanations.a: At the junction, some of the free electrons in the n-type wander into the p-type due to diffusion. As they diffuse into the p-type they combine with holes, and cancel each other out.
